benchmark_details.name: Killkan
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents Killkan, the first dataset for automatic speech recognition (ASR) in the Kichwa language, an indigenous language of Ecuador. The dataset contains approximately 4 hours of audio with transcription, translation into Spanish, and morphosyntactic annotation in the format of Universal Dependencies.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To build resources for automatic speech recognition and language technologies for the endangered Kichwa language.

data.source: The audio data was retrieved from a publicly available radio program
data.annotation: Time-aligned sentence-level transcriptions, Spanish translations, and morphosyntactic annotations compatible with Universal Dependencies.

methods: Fine-tuning a pretrained model (Wav2Vec2) for ASR
methodology.calculation: CER, WER, and WIL are calculated based on the discrepancies between predicted and actual transcriptions.
methodology.interpretation: A lower CER and WER indicate better performance in transcribing the ASR output.
methodology.baseline_results: Latest model achieved 2.04% CER on the test set.
methodology.validation: The dataset was fine-tuned against different sample sizes to test its performance across various levels of resource availability.
